an7.7:1.1: Then Ugga the government minister went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him,
an7.7:2.2: Migāra of Rohaṇa is so rich, so very wealthy.”
an7.7:2.4: “He has a hundred thousand gold coins, not to mention the silver!”
an7.7:2.5: “Well, Ugga, that is wealth, I can’t deny it.
an7.7:2.6: But fire, water, rulers, thieves, and unloved heirs all take a share of that wealth.
an7.7:2.7: There are these seven kinds of wealth that they can’t take a share of.
an7.7:2.9: The wealth of faith, ethical conduct, conscience, prudence, learning, generosity, and wisdom.
an7.7:2.10: There are these seven kinds of wealth that fire, water, rulers, thieves, and unloved heirs can’t take a share of.
an7.7:3.1: Faith and ethical conduct are kinds of wealth,
an7.7:3.4: and wisdom is the seventh kind of wealth.
an7.7:4.3: they’re really rich in the world,
an7.7:5.1: So let the wise devote themselves
an7.7:5.3: confidence, and insight into the teaching,
an7.7:5.4: remembering the instructions of the Buddhas.”
